What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic Italian reading, speaking, and writing
I learned the basics of Italian grammar, spoken language, and culture. Specifically we learned how to speak in the present and past tenses.
Learned basic Italian vocabulary and grammar including the present and past tenses. Learned a bit about Italian culture.
Reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills in Italian.
basic italian and a bit of culture too!
Introductory Italian vocabs and grammar & basic communication skills.
I learned to speak elementary italian
How to form basic sentences in the present, past, and future tense.
So many! I went  from 0 to 1 so fast.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was run very well
The strength of the course was how it was structured. I liked having Professor Iacovella and Professor Pellegrino alternate in what they teach.

Despite the course being over Zoom, Anna and Deborah (the instructors) took the time to get to know each of us, and used breakout rooms a lot so that we would get to know the other students in the class as well. They made sure we understood each of the grammar sections before moving on.

It might have been nice to get to read stories or other texts outside of the textbook, but this isn't a big deal.

The speaking practice is wonderful, better than any foreign language course I have ever taken. The instructors (Anna and Deborah) are intelligent, funny, kind, and extremely helpful. As an intensive class, it feels good to be really immersed in the language and cultureI think it is a much more efficient method of learning compared to taking 3-4 other classes in English at the same time.

On the other hand, it is difficult in five weeks to really internalize so much vocab, as well as other material. It can become a game of only focusing on the most recent material at the cost of the material learned a week or two ago. I am sure that a dedicated student can overcome this by taking lots of notes and frequently recopying them. The hardest aspect of the course, however, were exam daystaking an exam, writing a presentation, recording a presentation, and editing and uploading it all before midnight is a lot for one day.

it was great even over a virtual format. deborah and anna are both really amazing, I love how deborah uses the chat on zoom to show u words while we talk and anna does lots of fun kahoots. This class is such a pleasant experience

This is a great course that introduces you to the Italian language. Everything is well-explained and there are enough practices to help you understand. There are also various activities through which one can understand the Italian culture.
course was very fast paced

The class covers a lot of material which is great but often times does not go back to review past content. Obviously, since the class is condensed, there is less time to do so, but sometimes when it comes to topics that can be easily mixed up such as conditional tenses or pronouns, it can get confusing.
Weaknesses: feel like there wasn't clarity around grading

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, there were reasonable expectations for us and the class was a good introduction to Italian
I would definitely recommend this class to another student who either is interested in the Italian language and culture or wants to pick up a new language to fulfill their language requirement.
Yes.

I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this course. Professors Anna, Deborah, and Federica are all lovely and extremely helpful. This is a wonderful way to spend the summer. If your goal is to learn Italian and not just to get a good grade, commit to that goal and this class will be an extremely rewarding experience!

Yes, it definitely goes quickly and if you don't have any experience with a romance language you will have to put in a lot of time. That being said, it was extremely well organized and clear instruction. I loved this class and you should take it!
Definitely to anyone interested in learning another language from scratch. This course is very friendly to any beginner, and the class atmosphere is also great.
no
Yes! The professors are fantastic which can make or break a language class.
Yes - you learn so much and the teachers try hard to make it engaging
